title: The Virtuous Woman
shortSummary: Proverbs 31 presents the wise teachings of King Lemuel’s mother, emphasizing the importance of righteous leadership and the characteristics of a virtuous woman. The chapter highlights godly wisdom in leadership, the value of moral integrity, and the praise due to a woman who fears the LORD and diligently cares for her household.
timeline: c. 10th century BC - Wisdom literature attributed to King Lemuel's era

keyCharacters.name: King Lemuel
keyCharacters.description: A king who receives wise counsel from his mother, focusing on righteous leadership and avoiding destructive behaviors.

keyCharacters.name: Lemuel’s Mother
keyCharacters.description: The prophetic teacher who instructs her son on wise living, leadership, and the qualities of a virtuous woman.

keyCharacters.name: The Virtuous Woman
keyCharacters.description: An idealized woman described in detail for her wisdom, industriousness, kindness, and reverence for God.

definitions.definition: Possessing moral excellence and purity; in this context, a woman of noble character and godly wisdom.
A tool used in spinning wool or flax into thread, symbolizing industriousness and domestic skill.
A rich, red fabric often associated with wealth and dignity, indicating the woman’s provision for her household.
A reverential awe and respect for God that leads to obedience and godly living.

outline.heading: Introduction and Maternal Counsel to King Lemuel
outline.description: The chapter opens with King Lemuel recounting the wise instructions his mother gave him, urging him to avoid excess, especially wine, and to defend the rights of the poor and needy, emphasizing just leadership.

outline.heading: The Value of a Virtuous Woman
outline.description: This section introduces the virtuous woman, highlighting her priceless worth and the trust and goodness she brings to her husband.

outline.heading: The Industrious and Caring Woman
outline.description: A detailed description of her diligent work ethic, resourcefulness, and care for her household, demonstrating wisdom and strength.

outline.heading: Her Compassion and Preparedness
outline.description: She extends generosity to the poor, prepares her household for all seasons, and supports her husband’s standing in the community.

outline.heading: Her Business Acumen and Wisdom
outline.description: The woman is portrayed as a wise entrepreneur who manages her household well and speaks with kindness and wisdom.

outline.heading: The Praise Due to the Godly Woman
outline.description: Her children and husband honor her, and the chapter closes by affirming that a woman who fears the LORD is truly praiseworthy above all.

application: Seek godly wisdom and counsel in leadership and daily decisions, avoiding behaviors that lead to moral compromise.
Value and honor the godly women in your life who demonstrate faith, diligence, and kindness in their roles.
Cultivate a spirit of generosity and care for those in need, reflecting the compassion described in Proverbs 31.
Embrace the fear of the LORD as the foundation for a life that brings true honor and lasting praise.

keyVerses.text: Who can find a virtuous woman? for her price is far above rubies.
keyVerses.significance: This verse emphasizes the incomparable value of a woman of noble character and godly virtue.

keyVerses.text: Strength and honour are her clothing; and she shall rejoice in time to come.
keyVerses.significance: It highlights the inner qualities of strength and dignity that adorn the virtuous woman, promising her future joy.

keyVerses.text: Favour is deceitful, and beauty is vain: but a woman that feareth the LORD, she shall be praised.
keyVerses.significance: This verse teaches that true worth comes from reverence for God rather than outward appearance or charm.
